DataElement.preferredName: Patient Greater Than or Equal One Week Topical Retinoid Mechlorethamine Imiquimod Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Yes No Not Applicable Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to signify whether a patient has received topic therapy that includes retinoids, nitrogen mustard or Imiquimod with the past one week.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Greater Than or Equal One Week Topical Retinoid Mechlorethamine Imiquimod Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Text term to signify whether a patient has received any topical retinoid, nitrogen mustard or imiquimod within the past one week.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Greater Than or Equal To One Week Topical Retinoid Mechlorethamine Imiquimod Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.:The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.:Any period of seven consecutive days.:On the surface of the body.:Class of compounds consisting of four isoprenoid units joined in a head-to-tail manner and customarily containing five conjugated double bonds.:A synthetic agent related to sulphur mustard with antineoplastic and immunosuppressive properties. Nitrogen mustard (a member of a family of chemotherapy agents including cyclophosphamide and chlorambucil) is an irritant and carcinogenic agent metabolized to a highly reactive ethylene immonium derivative; the ethylene immonium derivative alkylates DNA and inhibits DNA replication. This agent also exhibits lympholytic properties. (NCI04):A synthetic agent with immune response modifying activity. As an immune response modifier (IRM), imiquimod stimulates cytokine production, especially interferon production, and exhibits antitumor activity, particularly against cutaneous cancers. Imiquimod's proapoptotic activity appears to be related to Bcl-2 overexpression in susceptible tumor cells. (NCI04):Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.
The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.
Any period of seven consecutive days.
On the surface of the body.
Class of compounds consisting of four isoprenoid units joined in a head-to-tail manner and customarily containing five conjugated double bonds.

A synthetic agent related to sulphur mustard with antineoplastic and immunosuppressive properties. Nitrogen mustard (a member of a family of chemotherapy agents including cyclophosphamide and chlorambucil) is an irritant and carcinogenic agent metabolized to a highly reactive ethylene immonium derivative; the ethylene immonium derivative alkylates DNA and inhibits DNA replication. This agent also exhibits lympholytic properties. (NCI04)

A synthetic agent with immune response modifying activity. As an immune response modifier (IRM), imiquimod stimulates cytokine production, especially interferon production, and exhibits antitumor activity, particularly against cutaneous cancers. Imiquimod's proapoptotic activity appears to be related to Bcl-2 overexpression in susceptible tumor cells. (NCI04)
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

ReferenceDocuments.name: >=1 week for topical therapy
ReferenceDocuments.description: >=1 week for topical therapy (including retinoid, nitrogen mustard, or imiquimod)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was last dose of topical therapy (including retinoid, nitrogen mustard, or imiquimod) greater than or equal to 1 week?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN-1
ReferenceDocuments.description: >=1 week from treatment with topical therapy (including retinoid, nitrogen mustard, or imiquimod).
